block.p: Anne Wylde Robinson and Kevin Hyland Moriarty, both lawyers, were married yesterday at Christ Church Cathedral in New Orleans. Canon Steven M. Roberts, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Denis J. Ryan, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Ms. Robinson, 29, is keeping her name. She is an associate in the Washington office of Latham & Watkins, the Los Angeles law firm. She graduated from Duke and received her law degree from Harvard, where she was the editor in chief of the Journal of Law & Gender.

Anne Wylde Robinson and Kevin Hyland Moriarty, both lawyers, were married yesterday at Christ Church Cathedral in New Orleans. Canon Steven M. Roberts, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Denis J. Ryan, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Anne Wylde Robinson and Kevin Hyland Moriarty, both lawyers, were married yesterday at Christ Church Cathedral in New Orleans. Canon Steven M. Roberts, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Denis J. Ryan, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part.

Ms. Robinson, 29, is keeping her name. She is an associate in the Washington office of Latham & Watkins, the Los Angeles law firm. She graduated from Duke and received her law degree from Harvard, where she was the editor in chief of the Journal of Law & Gender.
She is a daughter of Judith D. Robinson and Walter J. Robinson III of Atherton, Calif. Her father is a partner, in the Palo Alto, Calif., office of Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman, the law firm.

Mr. Moriarty, also 29, is an associate in the Washington office of Wilmer Cutler Pickering Hale & Dorr, the law firm. He graduated from Princeton and received his law degree from New York University, where he was the editor in chief of the law school's newspaper.

He is a son of Karen H. Moriarty and Daniel F. Moriarty of Bradenton, Fla. The bridegroom's mother retired as a guidance counselor at Tigard High School in Tigard, Ore. His father retired as the president of Portland Community College in Portland, Ore.
